Award]]\n|{{won}}\n|-\n{{Dagger}}: Not a Grammy Award, but awarded by [[The Recording Academy]]\n|rowspan=\"4\"| 2023\n|rowspan=\"2\"| \"[[Just Like That (Bonnie Raitt song)|Just Like That]]\"\n|Song of the Year\n|{{won}}\n|-\n|[[Grammy Award for Best American Roots Song|Best American Roots Song]]\n|{{won}}\n|-\n|''[[Just Like That...]]''\n|Best Americana Album\n|{{nom}}\n|-\n|\"Made Up Mind\"\n|[[Grammy Award for Best Americana Performance|Best Americana Performance]]\n|{{won}}\n|}\n\n; Americana Music Honors and Awards\n{{Awards table}}\n|-\n|2012\n|Herself\n|[[Americana Music Honors & Awards#Lifetime Achievement Award for Performance|Lifetime Achievement Award for Performance]]\n| {{won}}\n|-\n|2016\n|Herself\n|[[Americana Music Honors & Awards#Artist of the Year|Artist of the Year]]\n| {{Nom}}\n|-\n|[[2023 Americana Music Honors & Awards|2023]]\n|\"[[Just Like That (Bonnie Raitt song)|Just Like That]]\"\n|Song of the Year\n|{{won}}\n|}\n\n; Rock and Roll Hall of Fame\n{{Awards table}}\n|-\n|2000\n|Herself\n|[[List of Rock and Roll Hall of Fame inductees|Hall of Fame induction]]\n| {{won}}\n|}\n\n; Other awards\n* In 1992, Raitt was awarded an Honorary Doctorate of Music from [[Berklee College of Music]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://college.berklee.edu/about/honorary-degree-recipients |title=Honorary Degree Recipients |author=<!--Not stated--> |date=2022 |website=Berklee College of Music |access-date=November 9, 2022}}</ref>\n* In 1997, Raitt was awarded the [[Harvard Arts Medal]].<ref>{{cite web |title=Harvard Arts Medal |url=https://ofa.fas.harvard.edu/harvard-arts-medal |website=Harvard University Office for the Arts |access-date=18 February 2019}}</ref>\n* In 2017, Raitt was honored with a Lifetime Achievement Award from the [[National Guitar Museum]].<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/ShoreFire/status/964175770108268544|title=Shore Fire Media on Twitter|website=twitter.com|access-date=April 27, 2018|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180427210810/https://twitter.com/ShoreFire/status/964175770108268544|archive-date=April 27, 2018|df=mdy-all}}</ref>\n* In 2018, Raitt received the People's Voice Award from the [[Folk Alliance International|Folk Alliance International Awards]] in recognition of her activism.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://twitter.com/folkalliance/status/963962734386827264|title=Folk Alliance on Twitter|website=twitter.com|access-date=April 27, 2018|url-status=live|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20180427210810/https://twitter.com/folkalliance/status/963962734386827264|archive-date=April 27, 2018|df=mdy-all}}</ref>\n* In 2022, Raitt received the [[Billboard Women in Music#Icon Award|Icon Award]] at the [[Billboard Women in Music|Billboard Women in Music Awards]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.billboard.com/music/awards/billboard-women-in-music-bonnie-raitt-doja-cat-karol-g-1235022450/ |title=Billboard's 2022 Women In Music Awards to Honor Bonnie Raitt, Doja Cat, Karol G & More |last=Aniftos |first=Rania |date=January 27, 2022 |website=billboard.com |access-date=March 3, 2022}}</ref>\n* In 2024, Raitt will receive the [[Kennedy Center Honor]].<ref>[https://www.broadwaynews.com/kennedy-center-announces-47th-class-of-honorees/#:~:text=The%20annual%20gala%2C%20scheduled%20for,artists%20from%20around%20the%20world. Kennedy Center Announces 47th Class of Honorees]</ref>\n\n==References==\n=== Citations ===\n{{Reflist}}\n\n=== General references ===\n* {{cite book|last=Bego|first=Mark|title=Bonnie Raitt : Just in the Nick of Time|publisher=[[Rowman & Littlefield]]|year=1995|isbn=978-1-5597-2315-2|url-access=registration|url=https://archive.org/details/bonnieraittjusti00bego}}\n* {{cite book|last1=Schmidt|first1=Eric Von|last2=Rooney|first2=Jim|title=Baby, Let Me Follow You Down: The Illustrated Story of the Cambridge Folk Years|publisher=[[University of Massachusetts Press]]|year=1979|edition=2nd|isbn=0-87023-925-2|url-access=registration|url=https://archive.org/details/babyletmefollowy00vons}}\n\n==External links==\n{{commons}}\n*{{Official website|www.bonnieraitt.com}}\n*[https://www.bonnieraitt.eu/ Fansite: Bonnie's Pride and Joy]\n*[{{AllMusic|class=artist|id=p5222|pure_url=yes}} Allmusic Guide Profile]\n\n{{Bonnie Raitt}}\n{{Navboxes\n|title = Awards for Bonnie Raitt\n|list =\n{{Grammy Award for Album of the Year}}\n{{Grammy Award for Song of the Year}}\n{{Grammy Award for Best Pop Vocal Album}}\n{{Grammy Award for Best Rock Performance by a Duo or Group with Vocal}}\n{{Grammy Lifetime Achievement Award}}\n{{Kennedy Center Honorees 2020s}}\n{{MusiCares Person of the Year}}\n{{2000 Rock and Roll Hall of Fame}}\n}}\n{{US anti-nuclear movement}}\n{{Portal bar|Biography|Blues|Rock music}}\n{{Authority control}}\n\n{{DEFAULTSORT:Raitt, Bonnie}}\n[[Category:Bonnie Raitt| ]]\n[[Category:1949 births]]\n[[Category:Living people]]\n[[Category:American alternative country singers]]\n[[Category:American women country singers]]\n[[Category:American country singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American anti\u2013nuclear power activists]]\n[[Category:American blues guitarists]]\n[[Category:American blues pianists]]\n[[Category:20th-century American pianists]]\n[[Category:20th-century American women pianists]]\n[[Category:21st-century American pianists]]\n[[Category:21st-century American women pianists]]\n[[Category:American blues singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American women rock singers]]\n[[Category:American women singer-songwriters]]\n[[Category:American folk rock musicians]]\n[[Category:American folk
